author: Matt Addison
title: Liverpool player ratings, winners and losers vs Leicester as Cody Gakpo and 5 more impress
text:
ANFIELD, LIVERPOOL // Liverpool moved seven points ahead of Chelsea, capitalizing on the West London side's defeat to Fulham by putting Leicester City to the sword in the Anfield fog.
Jordan Ayew finished well to open the scoring inside the first few minutes of the game but it was Liverpool bombarding Jakub Stolarczyk's goal with shots. Eventually, Cody Gakpo curled a brilliant equalizer into the back of the net after cutting inside from the left, scoring to make it 1-1 just before half-time.
It took only a couple of minutes of the second half for Curtis Jones to put Liverpool in front after a lengthy VAR check. And when Mohamed Salah found the bottom corner, the result was done.
Winners
Gakpo continued his good form in the final third and Jones getting on the scoresheet again while playing as the number 10 can only be a good thing too. The strength of the Liverpool bench, with Federico Chiesa back and Luis Diaz rested, was another big bonus. Moving seven points clear at the top of the table, it was a winning day all around for the Reds.
Losers
Darwin Nunez would have wanted to score while he was handed a rare chance to start a game but he missed a couple of opportunities and was caught offside a couple of times too. It wasn't a bad showing, but it wasn't the start of the number nine pecking order changing either. Arne Slot was giving him plenty of positional instructions from the sidelines.
Player ratings
Alisson Becker (6). Beaten by a good early finish that left him with no chance down low to his right. The Brazilian wasn't hugely involved apart from that, which is a familiar situation for him.
Trent Alexander-Arnold (6). Caught out of position in the move that led to the Ayew goal and was slow to get back a couple of times against Stephy Mvididi, who is a tricky customer. Some of his crossing was sensational but some of his passes didn't hit the mark.
Joe Gomez (7). Commanding and front-footed in his challenges and usually good in possession, too. Patson Daka didn't get much change out of him. Harshly booked for the most minimal of fouls.
Virgil van Dijk (7). Like Gomez and Alisson, he did what he needed to do. Aside from that, there wasn't much more to report on. His passing ability is useful in matches like these but the big switch wasn't often on because of how compact the Foxes were.
Andy Robertson (6). Turned a little easily on the opening goal and didn't always make the most of the opportunities that he had to cross when he was in good positions. Solid enough defensively.
Buy the new Nike Liverpool home shirt here
The new Liverpool home shirt for the 2024/2025 season features a chrome yellow pattern design and is a modern take on the legendary '84 home shirt - a season which saw the Reds become European Champions for the fourth time in Rome and the first English Club to win a treble of major honours. You can buy it now.
¬£60-¬£125
Liverpool FCRyan Gravenberch (7). The Dutchman is really useful in every game, but especially in matches where there is a low block to break down. He kept things ticking here and ensured there was sustained pressure. Eventually, that was going to tell.
Alexis Mac Allister (6). It was a quiet-ish performance from the Argentine. He kept things simple but this wasn't his most influential game. It didn't need to be.
Curtis Jones (7). Took the ball impressively on the half-turn a couple of times but sometimes got a bit crowded out in the middle of the field. Scored the goal to put Liverpool in front and could have got another with a good break into the box.
Mohamed Salah (7). Leicester kept him pretty quiet for the most part but eventually, he was able to score. There was little to no space to run into and he couldn't quite carve out enough of an angle on a couple of occasions. Sealing the game with Liverpool's third goal, though, Leicester finally couldn't get close enough to snuff out his threat.
Darwin Nunez (6). Wasn't particularly involved in the game first half and struggled for meaningful touches. In the second, that changed slightly when he held things up and began to link up with his teammates better.
Cody Gakpo (8). Scored a brilliant goal from the left hand side cutting inside onto his stronger foot. He knows how to beat his marker and his goalscoring form has been impressive this season so far. He's now into double figures in this campaign.
Substitutes
Diogo Jota (6). Looking sharp off the bench again, it was a slight surprise that he didn't start in this one. He got through plenty of off-the-ball work and should be in with a shout for the weekend.
Dominik Szoboszlai (6). Booked, which means he has picked up a one-match ban. It comes at a bad time, really, considering how good he was against Spurs, and that he only came off the bench here.
Kostas Tsimikas, Wataru Endo and Harvey Elliott also came on but they appeared too late to earn a rating.

author: VNExplorer
title: Elon Musk‚Äôs warning to the market takes a $82 billion bite out of Tesla‚Äîand the path forward is daunting
text:
Tesla CEO Elon Musk said Chinese automakers are ‚Äúextremely good.‚Äù
Tesla shares were down just over 12% on Thursday after CEO Elon Musk sounded the alarm over Chinese electric carmakers which he called the ‚Äúthe most competitive car companies in the world.‚Äù
On Tesla‚Äôs Wednesday earnings call, Musk claimed that Chinese carmakers, which include BYD, Geely, and SAIC, are ‚Äúextremely good,‚Äù and could threaten other carmakers in the U.S. and elsewhere if governments do not step in.
‚ÄúFrankly, if there are not trade barriers established, they will pretty much demolish most other car companies in the world,‚Äù he said.
In addition to Musk‚Äôs China comments, slower predicted sales numbers for 2024 and uncertainty about whether the Fed would lower interest rates this year took a $82 billion bite out of Tesla‚Äôs market cap on Thursday.
Tesla did not immediately respond to Fortune‚Äôs request for comment.
The stock was trading about 12% down from the previous night‚Äôs close on Thursday afternoon, at around $182, and was down 27% year-to-date, with some market onlookers calling for it to lose its label as one of the so-called ‚ÄúMagnificent Seven‚Äù stocks.
Dethroned as EV leader Earlier this month, Tesla lost its status as the world‚Äôs largest EV maker to the Warren Buffett-backed Chinese carmaker BYD, despite implementing multiple price cuts on its U.S. vehicles the prior year, in part to compete with lower-cost Chinese EVs.
BYD keeps its costs low in part by owning every step of the supply chain, including the production of lithium batteries‚Äîthe costliest component in electric vehicles. Still, some have accused BYD and other Chinese car companies of anticompetitive behavior.
The Biden administration has explored raising tariffs on Chinese EVs as the country continues to dominate the sector. Chinese electric vehicles are already subject to a 25% tariff in the U.S.
Investigators from the European Commission also plan to visit several Chinese automakers over the coming weeks as the European Union decides whether to raise tariffs on Chinese companies to protect European carmakers. European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in September accused Chinese automakers of benefitting from large state subsidies that keep their prices ‚Äúartificially low.‚Äù
‚ÄúThis is distorting our market,‚Äù she added.
Meanwhile, Tesla is in the process of launching its own lower-cost model that could allow it to compete in a distinct category from that of its higher price tag vehicles. Musk said on Wednesday‚Äôs earnings call that production will begin on Tesla‚Äôs ‚Äúnext-generation‚Äù $25,000 electric vehicle in mid-2025.
It is still unclear whether Tesla‚Äôs success in the more expensive EV category will translate to the lower-cost EV sector, which is largely dominated by Chinese companies. Still, in terms of licensing and partnering, Musk said Wednesday that Tesla is willing to play nice with Chinese companies‚Äîfor a price.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre also happy to license for self driving, perhaps license other technologies and anything that could be helpful in advancing the sustainable energy revolution,‚Äù he said.
Tesla‚Äôs drop almost equal to GM and Ford‚Äôs entire value The $82 billion decline in Tesla‚Äôs market value as of mid-afternoon on Thursday exceeds the entire valuations of both GM ($48 billion) and Ford ($45 billion), and equals around one-third that of Toyota ($270 billion). Since Tesla now confirms it won‚Äôt come anywhere near meeting its own, or Wall Street‚Äôs, expectations for either volume or margin growth in the next couple of years, the big question for investors is whether the stock‚Äôs newly discounted price accurately reflects the new, downsized expectations. The bulls will argue that at these prices, Tesla‚Äôs stock is still a good deal.
The numbers, however, are daunting. Though Tesla‚Äôs stock price is falling, so too are its earnings, meaning that its price-to-earnings multiple remains towering. In Q4, Tesla‚Äôs pre-tax income, excluding regulatory credits, was roughly $2 billion (after adjusting to a normalized tax rate and excluding a big one-time tax benefit). Its net earrings have fallen rapidly in the last quarters, going from $3.9 billion in Q4 of last year to $2.4 billion in Q3 before sliding once again.
A steep climb for its stock to recover Since Tesla presented virtually now positive on the call, let‚Äôs assume that its net income is now running at the current clip of $2 billion a quarter or $8 billion a year. That puts its price-to-earnings ratio at 72. How fast must Tesla‚Äôs profits wax to grow into that still astounding valuation?
For inventors to pocket a 10% annual gain over the next seven years, Tesla‚Äôs market cap would need to reach $1.2 trillion by early 2031. If we assume its PE will decline to a still-formidable 30, the EV giant will need to post GAAP net earnings of $40 billion. That‚Äôs almost half of what Apple makes now, 60% of Alphabet‚Äôs current profits, and twice what Toyota‚Äôs averaged over the past three years.
The chances of getting anywhere near a double-digit return gets even dimmer if Musk gets his way, and the Tesla board awards him an extra 12% or 13% of Tesla equity to entice the maverick to develop an AI juggernaut for the automaker. Musk wants the shares for free as a reward for his additional services. Unlike any other stock offering, this one wouldn‚Äôt put cash for investment in Tesla‚Äôs war chest. Put simply, the move would dilute current shareholders so that instead of owning 88% of Tesla, they own 76% or 77%. Hence, their share of the hypothetical, probably mythological $1.2 trillion valuation would go from $1.05 trillion to $920 billion, cutting their return from 10% to 8.8%.
The last thing Tesla investors need is for Musk to raise the bar for garnering decent gains on his stock. Even the Tesla bulls must be questioning whether Elon himself sees where his stock is headed, and wants to get a lot more for free to cushion the blow.
This story was originally featured on Fortune.com

author: Newsroom Staff
title: New festival "Fermentopia" celebrates all things fermented in Phoenix - NewsBreak
text:
By Newsroom Staff ,
14 hours ago PHOENIX, Ore ‚Äî Cheese, coffee, and kombucha might seem like unrelated items found on the menu of your average bistro or caf√©, but they are all members of the same family of fermented foodstuffs. First-year festival, ‚ÄúFermentopia‚Äù is a two-day celebration of all those products that have undergone the bubbly process of fermentation. Wild Thyme Productions owner, Karolina Lavagnino, is the festival organizer, and she joined Emily Storm on Sunrise this morning to tell us all about Fermentopia. Read full article
Read in NewsBreak

author: Alexandra Ringendahl
title: Katholische Grundschule: K√∂lner Eltern lehnen kirchliche Regeln ab
text:
Mit der Nippeser Maternusschule wurde binnen anderthalb Jahren die f√ºnfte katholische Grundschule in K√∂ln zur Gemeinschaftsgrundschule.
Katholische GrundschuleK√∂lner Eltern wollen nicht mehr, dass die Kirche die Regeln macht
Das Votum der Eltern war eindeutig: Mit √ºberw√§ltigender Mehrheit stimmten die Eltern der Nippeser Katholischen Maternus-Grundschule f√ºr die Umwandlung der Schule. Nach den Sommerferien wird die einzige katholische Schule im Stadtteil Nippes damit eine Gemeinschaftsgrundschule. Bei 211 abgegebenen Stimmen gab es nur sechs Nein-Stimmen. Im Schulausschuss wurde das Votum der Eltern am Montag auch formal als Umwandlungsbeschluss best√§tigt.
Damit ist die Nippeser Grundschule innerhalb der vergangenen anderthalb Jahre bereits die f√ºnfte K√∂lner katholische Grundschule, die beschlossen hat, nicht l√§nger katholisch zu sein. Neben der Michael-Ende-Grundschule in Ehrenfeld entschieden sich auch in Ossendorf die Peter-Lustig-Grundschule, die Grundschule Forststra√üe in Rath und die Grundschule Langema√ü in M√ºlheim daf√ºr.
‚ÄûAlle Familien sollen sich willkommen f√ºhlen‚Äú
Grundlage der Umwandlungen ist immer das Engagement der Eltern vor Ort, die das Votum in Form einer Wahl organisieren m√ºssen. Hauptargument vieler Eltern ist, dass sie nicht mehr hinnehmen m√∂chten, dass katholische Kinder bei der Aufnahme an der Schule bevorzugt werden. Gerade angesichts knapper Grundschulpl√§tze in K√∂ln finden immer mehr Eltern wichtig, dass die Kinder einen Platz bekommen, die wirklich in der N√§he wohnen. Sie wollten, ‚Äûdass sich alle Familien weiterhin unabh√§ngig von Konfession, Herkunft, sexueller Orientierung oder privater Lebensentw√ºrfe an unserer Schule willkommen f√ºhlen‚Äú, hie√ü es von Seiten der Nippeser Elterninitiative, die das Votum angesto√üen hatte. Zudem seien nur noch ein Viertel der Kinder katholisch.
In Nordrhein-Westfalen ist derzeit noch jede dritte der 3000 Grundschulen eine konfessionelle Bekenntnisschule. In K√∂ln sind es 43 von 151 Grundschulen. Dabei sind katholische Bekenntnisgrundschulen ‚Äì anders als katholische Privatschulen wie etwa die K√∂lner erzbisch√∂flichen Gymnasien ‚Äì komplett in staatlicher Tr√§gerschaft und werden zu 100 Prozent vom Staat finanziert.
Trotzdem gibt die Kirche die Aufnahmeregeln vor. Genommen werden m√ºssen zun√§chst Kinder der jeweiligen Konfession. Bei einem Anmelde√ºberhang haben Kinder anderer Konfession, konfessionsfreie Kinder oder Kinder mit anderer Religionszugeh√∂rigkeit das Nachsehen, auch wenn die angemeldeten katholischen Kinder deutlich weiter entfernt von der Schule wohnen.
Anmelde√ºberh√§nge an vielen Grundschulen
Brisanz hat das Thema, weil es in K√∂ln bei einem hohen Anteil der Grundschulen Anmelde√ºberh√§nge gibt und vor allem Grundschulpl√§tze in K√∂ln knapp sind. Regelm√§√üig von Anmelde√ºberh√§ngen betroffene Schulleitungen berichten, dass nicht-katholische Eltern da, wo Pl√§tze knapp sind, inzwischen Sorge haben, ihr Kind dort anzumelden aus Angst vor einer Absage.
Hinzu kommt, dass an einer katholischen Grundschule die Schulleitung zwingend katholisch sein muss. Gleichzeitig sind derzeit mehr als zehn Grundschulen ohne Leitung, weil Bewerberinnen und Bewerber rar sind. Katholische allemal. Die Umwandlung in eine Gemeinschaftsgrundschule erh√∂ht also die Chancen auf eine Stellenbesetzung in der bestehenden Mangellage, was vielerorts ‚Äì gerade dort, wo eine Neubesetzung in n√§chster Zeit ansteht ‚Äì ein Argument f√ºr Eltern ist.
Bekenntnisschulen sind in Nordrhein-Westfalen Teil der Landesverfassung. Es gibt sie allerdings au√üer in NRW nur noch in Niedersachsen. Dabei sind die H√ºrden im Umwandlungsprozess hoch: Grundschulen sind laut Schulgesetz NRW umzuwandeln, wenn sich mehr als 50 Prozent der Eltern in einer formalen Wahl daf√ºr entscheiden. Die Sache hat allerdings einen Haken: Die Eltern, die nicht an der Wahl teilnehmen, werden als Neinstimmen gez√§hlt.
Die NRW-weite Initiative ‚ÄûKurze Beine ‚Äì Kurze Wege‚Äú setzt sich daf√ºr ein, dass m√∂glichst viele katholische Bekenntnisschulen zu Gemeinschaftsgrundschulen werden. Ihr Hauptargument: Wenn die Steuerzahler die Schulen finanzieren, d√ºrfe es nicht sein, dass bei zu vielen Anmeldungen die Sch√ºler eines Bekenntnisses bevorzugt werden. Daher ber√§t und unterst√ºtzt sie Schulen auf dem Weg der Umwandlung. An den umgewandelten Schulen √§ndert sich abgesehen von dem neuen Status nichts: Es gibt weiter konfessionellen Religionsunterricht, der durch das Wahlfach Praktische Philosophie erg√§nzt wird. Auch Schulgottesdienste gibt es weiterhin, ebenso wie die Feier christlicher Feste.

author: SGT
title: Here It Comes: California Has Declared A State Of Emergency Due To The Bird Flu, And A ‚ÄúSevere‚Äù Human Case Has Been Confirmed In Louisiana
text:
by Michael Snyder, End Of The American Dream :
Are we on the verge of another major public health crisis? Will we soon see the return of lockdowns, shutdowns, testing, masks and mandates? Since 2022, the H5N1 bird flu has been causing chaos all over the globe. According to NBC News , 123 million birds ‚Äúhave been killed or euthanized‚Äù in the United States, and a new wave of the outbreak has arrived this winter with a vengeance. That is one of the primary reasons why eggs are now so expensive all over the country. Unfortunately, the H5N1 bird flu is also spreading like wildfire among dairy cows. This month it is ripping through hundreds of dairy herds in the state of California, and as a result a state of emergency has just been declared ‚Ä¶
TRUTH LIVES on at https://sgtreport.tv/
California has declared a state of emergency for H5N1 bird flu amid fears that the virus could jump to people and start to spread.
The move comes in response to a major outbreak of the virus among the state‚Äôs cattle which has spilled over and infected dozens of dairy workers.
What we are witnessing in California right now is truly alarming.
So far, 645 dairy herds have been affected as bird flu roars across the state.
Almost half of those dairy herds have been hit just within the past 30 days ‚Ä¶
California has identified H5N1 in 645 dairy herds since its first detection in late August and nearly half of those were reported in the past 30 days, highlighting the rapid spread of the virus.
Thirty-four of the US‚Äô 61 human bird flu cases have also been in California.
This is a really big deal.
In a previous article , I discussed the fact that piles of dead cows have been spotted ‚Äústacked along roadsides rotting in the heat‚Äù in rural parts of the state‚Ä¶
A dystopian scene is emerging in California as dairy farmers battle a ruthless disease.
Dead cows and calves stacked along roadsides rotting in the heat surrounded by crows, vultures and thick swarms of black flies.
After wiping out tens of millions of birds worldwide, the H5N1 avian flu is tearing through dairy farms in the US.
When it was just birds that were dropping dead, most people were not too concerned.
But dairy cows are mammals just like us.
And now dozens of humans are getting infected.
In fact, the very first ‚Äúsevere‚Äù human case of H5N1 has been confirmed in the state of Louisiana. The following comes from the official CDC website ‚Ä¶
A patient has been hospitalized with a severe case of avian influenza A(H5N1) virus (‚ÄúH5N1 bird flu‚Äù) infection in Louisiana. This marks the first instance of severe illness linked to the virus in the United States. The case was confirmed by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Friday, December 13. Since April 2024, there have been a total of 61 reported human cases of H5 bird flu reported in the United States.
Partial viral genome data of the H5N1 avian influenza virus that infected the patient in Louisiana indicates that the virus belongs to the D1.1 genotype related to other D1.1 viruses recently detected in wild birds and poultry in the United States and in recent human cases in British Columbia, Canada, and Washington state. This H5N1 bird flu genotype is different than the B3.13 genotype detected in dairy cows, sporadic human cases in multiple states, and some poultry outbreaks in the United States. Additional genomic sequencing and efforts to isolate virus from clinical specimens from the patient in Louisiana are underway at CDC.
We aren‚Äôt being told much about the victim other than the fact that this particular individual is ‚Äúcurrently hospitalized in critical condition‚Äù ‚Ä¶
American flag merchandise ‚ÄúThe patient is experiencing severe respiratory illness related to H5N1 infection and is currently hospitalized in critical condition,‚Äù said Emma Herrock, a spokeswoman for the Louisiana Department of Health.
Of course this wasn‚Äôt the first such case in North America.
Last month, a teenager in Canada had to be hospitalized after getting infected with the bird flu‚Ä¶
A teenager in British Columbia was hospitalized in November after contracting the same genotype of the bird flu virus. Canadian health officials were not able to determine the source of the teen‚Äôs infection.
Read More @ EndOfTheAmericanDream.com

author: Dele Anofi
title: Fed Govt launches free Caesarean section for women
text:
The Federal Government has launched free Caesarean Section for Nigerian women who need the procedure, especially the poor and the vulnerable.
Caesarean Section is a surgical procedure that involves delivering a baby through incisions on the mother‚Äôs abdomen and uterus.
The initiative, according to the government, is in furtherance of its commitment to reducing maternal and newborn mortality across Nigeria.
The Coordinating Minister of Health and Social Welfare, Prof. Muhammad Pate , announced this yesterday in Abuja at the ongoing three-day Nigeria Health Sector-Wide Joint Annual Review.
The announcement came on the heels of the launch of the Maternal Mortality Reduction Innovation Initiative.
The Joint Annual Health Review aims to conduct a thorough assessment of Nigeria‚Äôs healthcare system, identifying challenges and implementing impactful solutions to ease both the physical and financial burdens on our people.
Confirming this on the official X (formerly Twitter) handle of the Federal Ministry of Health and Social Welfare, Pate said: ‚ÄúNo woman should lose her life simply because she can‚Äôt afford a C-section.‚Äù
The tweet reads: ‚ÄúIn a powerful move, Coordinating Minister @muhammadpate just announced that Cesarean Sections for all Nigerian women who need them will now be FREE!‚Äù
Related News The minister added that the initiative would provide free cesarean sections for eligible poor and vulnerable women, available through public and private facilities empanelled by the National Health Insurance Authority.
‚ÄúBy removing financial barriers to this life-saving procedure, we ensure that no woman in need is denied critical care due to cost. Maternal mortality remains unacceptably high, with 172 local governments contributing to over 50 per cent of maternal deaths.
‚ÄúBy focusing resources on these high-burden areas, MAMII (Maternal Mortality-Reduction Innovation and Initiatives) will address the greatest areas of need. The NHIA (National Health Insurance Authority), in collaboration with the National Primary Health Care Development Agency, and State Health Insurance Agencies, will manage the reimbursement process, ensuring that providers across both sectors can deliver these essential services sustainably.
‚ÄúCommunity health workers play a crucial role in this mission, in line with Mr. President‚Äôs initiative to onboard 120,000 additional health workers to support primary care across Nigeria. These workers are essential in generating demand for maternal care services within communities, educating families on the importance of antenatal care and ensuring that mothers are informed about available services.
‚ÄúIn rural and underserved areas, where accessing healthcare facilities remain a challenge, community health workers act as vital links between families and the healthcare system, bringing lifesaving information and support to their doorsteps.
‚ÄúIn these same areas, the National Emergency Medical Service and Ambulance System @Fmohnigeria have been revitalized to provide timely transport for emergencies, bridging a key gap in both maternal and newborn care by bringing emergency services closer to those who need them most,‚Äù he added.
Pate acknowledged that the initiative was made possible through the essential support of development partners, whose resources and expertise align with Nigeria‚Äôs health priorities.

organizations.name: Nigeria Health Sector-Wide Joint Annual Review
Federal Ministry of Health and Social Welfare

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Fans Say They 'Gasped' After Seeing Ginger Zee Rock the 'Perfect' Dress on TV
text:
By Carly Silva ,
3 hours ago
Leave it to Ginger Zee to get in touch with nature for her wardrobe choices.
The chief meteorologist at Good Morning America left viewers in awe of her stylish outfit during the Thursday, Sept. 19 broadcast, where she was seen sporting a stunning bird-inspired ensemble.
Zee, 43, shared photos of the look to Instagram after the show, giving her followers a glimpse at the dark teal dress that was stamped with a colorful bird pattern.
As seen in the social media pics‚Äîas well as footage of Zee in action while giving the day's weather report‚Äîfans got a close-up look at the long-sleeved garment, which featured depictions of vibrantly colored cardinals, hummingbirds, ducks and more recognizable birds.
The dress, made in a button-down style, was tied at the waist with a colorful peach, black and baby blue belt which Zee complimented with a pair of classic pink heels.
"I love wearing these bird dresses to hear @maxgolembo do all the bird calls. üòÇ," she wrote in her caption, while mentioning fellow meteorologist at GMA , Max Golembo .
Fans on social media absolutely adored Zee's avian style for the day, including one user who wrote in the comments, "I just saw your dress on TV and GASPED because it‚Äôs s perfect!! üòç"
"I love the way you wear it üòç," someone else gushed.
Another fan was ready to purchase their own dress just like it, telling Zee, "Love it. I will google bird dresses."
In her Instagram post, Zee credited her dress as being from the clothing brand Lesley Evers ‚Äîand it's not the first time Zee has rocked one of the unique bird styles.
Back in August 2023 , Zee was spotted in another dress covered in birds during a Good Morning America episode. The white short-sleeved dress, also from Lesley Evers, featured a very similar design, except for the white base fabric that made the birds pop even more.
"üî•Only Ginger Zee could rock that dress on national TV!" one fan wrote under Zee's Instagram post on Thursday.
"That dress is for the birds üòçüî•," someone else applauded.
Next: Fans Can't Get Enough of Ginger Zee's 'Fabulous' and Bold New Haircut
Expand All Read in NewsBreak
